title: Google Pixel XL stuck in a bootloop
content:
Last week my Google Pixel XL (first generation) went into an infinite bootloop.  I have tried the following

1. I tried to factory reset through the boot launcher - to no avail
2. I took the phone to Ubreak -Ifix and their conclusion was that the device motherboard is damaged. 

My phone is justa a little over 2 years old, and has no physical or other damage to it. And I am a little disappointed as to why the mother board is damaged in two years time.

I understand it is out of warranty, but am disappointed that it only lasted two years. 

Is there something Google can help me with? Can I ship the phone to google and get some feedback on what might have gone wrong? I enjoyed using the device while I had it. And look forward to a new one. But the motherboard being defective is concerning.
